page.title: 05ECOLOGY 1
page.content: Near our school there are 6 different habitats for animals. There is some unfarmed grassland with small trees and wild flowers. Many invertebrates live in this grass.{Meadow Brown} butterflies thrive here along with {Burnets}in huge numbers. The invertebrates provide food for{shrews, {hedgehogs}and many birds, including {grouse, partridges, sky-lark,}and {starlings. Moles}live on{worms} underground.{Rabbits, hares, fieldmice and{fieldvoles}eat the plants that grow there and in turn are preyed on by{kestrels, foxes, tawny owls, {weasels}and stoats. There are patches of woodland scrub which gives cover to {pheasants}and{wood mice}and to the {foxes}and{stoats}that hunt in other habitats. Occasionally we have seen {grey squirrels.}
